children.name: Get an overview of your Issue-to-Resolution (ITR) Process

blocks.text: This Dashboard provides a high-level overview of your Issue-to-Resolution Process in Jira. It highlights some key KPIs as well as a high-level analysis of the process to identify areas to investigate further.
Page 2 - Discovery: A process model from your event log data, displays the most common process paths.
Page 3 - Issue Details: Overview of issues by their type, status, and priority.
Page 4: - SLA Overview: SLAs and their breaches.
Page 5: - SLA Details: A deep dive into the details of the SLAs on the issue level.

Please see our Dashboard Documentation for more information on how to manage your dashboards.
Kindly provide feedback on the Dashboard, this will aid us in enhancing its functionality.

children.name: Number of  Total Issues
children.description: All Issues covered in the Data Set, regardless their Status

dataSource.query: SELECT COUNT(case_id) FROM THIS_PROCESS

children.name: Number of Open Issues
children.description: All Issues not in Status 'Done'

dataSource.query: SELECT COUNT(case_id) FILTER ( WHERE "Current Status category" != 'Done') FROM THIS_PROCESS

children.name: Avg. Closing Time
children.description: Average time from issue creation to its closing

dataSource.query:
SELECT
AVG(
	IF ("Issue Type" = '[System] Change',
		(SELECT LAST(end_time) WHERE event_name IN ('Issue status change: Canceled', 'Issue status change: Completed', 'Issue status change: Failed'))
		-("Issue Created Date"),
		(SELECT LAST(end_time) WHERE event_name IN ('Issue status change: Closed', 'Issue status change: Done'))
		-("Issue Created Date"))
)
FROM THIS_PROCESS

children.name: Avg. Resolution Time
children.description: Average time from Issue creation to its resolution

dataSource.query: SELECT AVG("Issue Resolution Date" - "Issue Created Date") FILTER (WHERE "Resolution" IS NOT NULL) FROM THIS_PROCESS

children.name: Number of Issues by Project
children.description: Shows all Projects with their total number of Issues

dataSource.query:
SELECT COUNT (CASE_ID) AS "Cases", "Project"
FROM THIS_PROCESS
LIMIT 5

SELECT COUNT (CASE_ID) AS "# Cases" , "Issue Type"
FROM THIS_PROCESS
ORDER BY 1 desc
LIMIT 10

children.name: Avg. CSAT Score (1 to 5)
children.description: CSAT, or customer satisfaction score, is a commonly used metric that indicates how satisfied customers are with a company’s products or services. It’s measured through customer feedback and expressed as a percentage (5☆ would be fantastic – 0☆ would be terrible).

dataSource.query:
SELECT
	AVG("Satisfaction")
FROM THIS_PROCESS

children.name: Number of Resolved Issues
children.description: Total number of resolved issues

dataSource.query:
SELECT 
	COUNT(case_id) FILTER ( WHERE "Resolution" IS NOT NULL)
FROM THIS_PROCESS

SELECT 
  COUNT ("case_id") AS "# Issues", 
  DATE_TRUNC('month', "Issue Created Date") AS "Creation Date", 
  "Issue Type" AS "Issue Type"
FROM THIS_PROCESS
ORDER BY 2 ASC 
LIMIT 500

children.name: Project Progress
children.description: Number of Issues by Status and Project

children.name: Resolution Time by Month
children.description: Average Resolution Time from Issue creation to closing by Month

dataSource.query:
SELECT DATE_TRUNC('MONTH', (SELECT FIRST (END_TIME))) AS "Creation Date", AVG ("Issue Resolution Date"   - "Issue Created Date" ) AS "Resolution Time"
FROM THIS_PROCESS 
ORDER BY 1 ASC NULLS FIRST
FILL timeseries('MONTH')
LIMIT 500

children.name: Created Issues by Month (Cumulative)
children.description: All Issues created within a specific Month

dataSource.query:
SELECT 
	"Month", 
    "CaseCount" AS "Cases",
    SUM("CaseCount") OVER (ORDER BY "Month") AS "CumulativeCases"
FROM (
  SELECT 
  	COUNT(DISTINCT case_id) AS "CaseCount",
    DATE_TRUNC('MONTH', (SELECT FIRST(end_time))) as "Month"
  FROM THIS_PROCESS
) AS SUB
FILL TIMESERIES('MONTH'), NULL

blocks.text: This overview page serves as your starting point to the process intelligence analysis of your Jira environment. It provides an overview of all issues, issue types, and associated projects while highlighting the most important key figures and ITSM-specific attributes.

children.name: Avg. Response Time
children.description: Average time from Issue creation to its response

dataSource.query: SELECT AVG("First Response Date" - "Issue Created Date") FROM THIS_PROCESS

children.name: Number of Closed Issues
children.description: Average time from Issue creation to its closing

dataSource.query:
SELECT 
	COUNT(case_id) FILTER ( WHERE "Current Status category" == 'Done')
FROM THIS_PROCESS

children.name: AVG Response Time by Month
children.description: Average Response Time from Issue creation to first response by Month

dataSource.query:
SELECT 
  DATE_TRUNC('MONTH', (SELECT FIRST (END_TIME))) AS "Creation Date", 
  AVG("First Response Date" - "Issue Created Date") AS "Response Time"
FROM THIS_PROCESS 
ORDER BY 1 ASC NULLS FIRST
FILL timeseries('MONTH')
LIMIT 500

selectedVariants: Issue status change: Work in progress
Issue status change: Work in progress
SLA "Time to close after resolution" started
SLA "Time to close after resolution" fulfilled

children.name: Details Table
children.description: This table reflects all events to to their belonging case

dataSource.query:
SELECT "case_id" as "Case ID","Issue Key", "event_name" as "Event Name", "end_time" as "End Time" 
FROM FLATTEN (THIS_PROCESS) LIMIT 200

children.name: Number of Issues
children.description: Number of all Issues in the Data Set

children.name: Number of Events
children.description: Events counted in all Issues

children.name: Avg. Cycle time
children.description: Average Cycle Time of all open Issues regardless their Status

children.name: Number of Variants
children.description: Total number of Variants

blocks.text: The Process Discovery focus on your ITSM process flow and its variants. All variants can be individually highlighted and sorted by cycle time, case occurrence or other specific metrics.

children.name: Number of Issues by Status Category and Priority
children.description: This heatmap highlights the number of Issues grouped by priority. It allows a quick spot on areas containing the majority of tickets matching the criteria

children.name: Avg. Age of Open Issues by Type and Priority
children.description: Time from Issue creation until now for open issues

dataSource.query:
SELECT 
	AVG(NOW() - "Issue Created Date") as "Avg. Number of Days",
    "Issue Type",
    "Current Priority"
FROM THIS_PROCESS WHERE "Current Status category" != 'Done'

SELECT COUNT (CASE_ID) AS "Cases", "event_name" as "Status"
FROM flatten(THIS_PROCESS) WHERE "event_name" NOT LIKE 'SLA%'
ORDER BY 1 DESC NULLS LAST
LIMIT 5

children.name: AVG Resolution Time by Customer Request Type
children.description: Average Time to solve an Issue grouped by Customer Request Type

dataSource.query:
SELECT 
AVG ("Issue Resolution Date"   - "Issue Created Date" ) AS "Resolution Time", 
COUNT (CASE_ID) AS "Cases",
CASE WHEN "Request Type" IS NULL THEN 'Not Maintained' ELSE "Request Type" END AS "Request Type" 
FROM THIS_PROCESS
ORDER BY 1 DESC NULLS LAST
LIMIT 500

children.name: Number of Issues by Hour & Day of the Week
children.description: All issues by there creation date are displayed

dataSource.query:
SELECT 
COUNT ("case_id") AS "# Issues", 
DATE_PART('hour', "Issue Created Date") AS "Hour of day",
CASE
	WHEN DATE_PART('day_of_week', "Issue Created Date") = 0 THEN '(0) Monday'
    WHEN DATE_PART('day_of_week', "Issue Created Date") = 1 THEN '(1) Tuesday'
	WHEN DATE_PART('day_of_week', "Issue Created Date") = 2 THEN '(2) Wednesday'
    WHEN DATE_PART('day_of_week', "Issue Created Date") = 3 THEN '(3) Thursday'
    WHEN DATE_PART('day_of_week', "Issue Created Date") = 4 THEN '(4) Friday'
    WHEN DATE_PART('day_of_week', "Issue Created Date") = 5 THEN '(5) Saturday'
    WHEN DATE_PART('day_of_week', "Issue Created Date") = 6 THEN '(6) Sunday'
END AS "Day of week"
FROM THIS_PROCESS
ORDER BY 2 ASC, 3 ASC

blocks.text: This page is intended to provide and overview of issues by their type, status, and priority.

children.name: Details Table
children.description: This table shows the important details to an Issue for further tracking

dataSource.query:
SELECT 
"Issue Key", 
"Summary", 
"Project", 
"Current status", 
"Issue Type", 
"Issue Created Date" AS "Created Date",
"Issue Resolution Date" As "Resolution Date",
"Inward Issue Links Count" AS "# Inwards Issue Links",
"Outward Issue Links Count" AS "# Outwards Issue Links"

FROM THIS_PROCESS
LIMIT 200

SELECT COUNT (CASE_ID) AS "# Cases" , "Issue Type"
FROM THIS_PROCESS
ORDER BY 1 desc
LIMIT 10

children.name: Number of SLAs
children.description: Total number of SLAs

dataSource.query:
SELECT 
	SUM("SLA Definition Count")
FROM THIS_PROCESS
SELECT SUM("SLA Count Breaches") FROM THIS_PROCESS

children.name: Number of Ongoing SLAs
children.description: Total number of ongoing SLAs

dataSource.query: SELECT SUM("SLA Count Ongoing") FROM THIS_PROCESS

children.name: Number of Completed SLAs
children.description: Total number of completed SLAs

dataSource.query: SELECT SUM("SLA Count Completed") FROM THIS_PROCESS

children.name: SLA Breach Ratio
children.description: Percentage of cases with breached SLAs

dataSource.query:
SELECT 
	SUM("SLA Count Breaches")/SUM("SLA Definition Count")*100
FROM THIS_PROCESS

children.name: Breaches per SLA
children.description: This table shows an overview of breaches per SLA to spot areas of improvement

dataSource.query:
SELECT DISTINCT 
  "SLA Name" as "SLA name", 
  SUM(IF("Breached" = 'TRUE', 1, 0)) as "# Breached",
  SUM(IF("Breached" = 'FALSE', 1, 0)) as "# Non-Breached",
  count("event_name") as "# Total",
  SUM(IF("Breached" = 'TRUE', 1, 0)) / count("event_name") * 100 as "Breached Ratio"
FROM FLATTEN(THIS_PROCESS)
WHERE "event_name" like 'SLA%' AND "event_name" like '%started'

children.name: SLA Breached
children.description: Number of Breached vs. Non-breached SLAs, compared by AVG Resolution Time

dataSource.query:
SELECT 
	count("event_name") AS "# SLA", 
    AVG ("Issue Resolution Date"   - "Issue Created Date" ) AS "Avg. Resolution Time", 
    "Breached" AS "Is Breached?" 
FROM FLATTEN ( THIS_PROCESS ) WHERE "event_name" LIKE 'SLA%' AND "event_name" LIKE '%started'

children.name: Number of Paused SLAs
children.description: Total Number of Pauses occuring in SLAs

dataSource.query: SELECT SUM("SLA Count Paused") FROM THIS_PROCESS

children.name: SLA Breach Ratio over time
children.description: Breached Ratio per Months

dataSource.query:
SELECT 
  DATE_TRUNC('MONTH', (SELECT LAST (END_TIME))) AS "Day", 
  SUM ("SLA Count Breaches") / SUM ("SLA Definition Count") * 100 AS "SLA Breach Ratio"
FROM THIS_PROCESS 
ORDER BY 1 ASC NULLS FIRST
FILL timeseries('MONTH')
LIMIT 500

children.name: Project SLA Breach Ratio
children.description: SLA Breach Ratio by Project

dataSource.query:
SELECT 
  SUM ("SLA Count Breaches") / SUM ("SLA Definition Count") * 100 AS "SLA Breach Ratio", 
  "Project"
FROM THIS_PROCESS
ORDER BY 1 DESC NULLS LAST
LIMIT 500

blocks.text: This page sets the spotlight on SLAs and their breaches.

dataSource.query:
SELECT
  SUM ("SLA Count Breaches") / SUM ("SLA Definition Count") * 100 AS "SLA Breach Ratio",
  "Current Priority"
FROM THIS_PROCESS 
ORDER BY 1 DESC
LIMIT 500

SELECT 
  "Issue key",
  "SLA Name",
  "Start Time",
  "Cycle Type",
  "Breached",
  "Paused",
  "Breach Time",
  IF ("Breach Time" - NOW() < DURATION '0days', "Breach Time" - NOW(), NULL) as "Remaining Time",
  NOW()-"Start Time" as "Elapsed time"
FROM FLATTEN(THIS_PROCESS) WHERE "SLA Name" IS NOT NULL AND "Cycle Type" = 'ongoing'
LIMIT 200

children.name: Breaches per SLA
children.description: This table shows an overview of breaches per SLA to spot areas of improvement

dataSource.query:
SELECT DISTINCT 
  "SLA Name" as "SLA name", 
  SUM(IF("Breached" = 'TRUE', 1, 0)) as "# Breached",
  SUM(IF("Breached" = 'FALSE', 1, 0)) as "# Non-Breached",
  count("event_name") as "# Total",
  SUM(IF("Breached" = 'TRUE', 1, 0)) / count("event_name") * 100 as "Breached Ratio (%)"
FROM FLATTEN(THIS_PROCESS)
WHERE "event_name" like 'SLA%' AND "event_name" like '%started'

blocks.text: This page provides a deep dive into the details of the SLAs on issue level. That  allows quick checks on specific SLAs for a high priority issues.

children.name: Changes by Risk and Type
children.description: The Heatmap reflects the number of Changes by their Risk and Change Type. That helps to spot in which areas the most Changes occur

dataSource.query:
SELECT COUNT (CASE_ID) AS "Cases",CASE WHEN "Change Type" IS NULL THEN 'Not Maintained' ELSE "Change Type" END AS "Change Type", CASE WHEN "Change risk" IS NULL THEN 'Not Maintained' ELSE "Change Risk" END AS "Change Risk"
FROM THIS_PROCESS
LIMIT 500

SELECT COUNT (CASE_ID) AS "Cases",  CASE WHEN "Change Type" IS NULL THEN 'Not Maintained' ELSE "Change Type" END AS "Change Type"
FROM THIS_PROCESS
ORDER BY 2
LIMIT 500

children.name: Changes by Risk
children.description: Change by their Risk Category

dataSource.query:
SELECT COUNT (CASE_ID) AS "Cases",CASE WHEN "Change Risk" IS NULL THEN 'Not Maintained' ELSE "Change Risk" END AS "Change Risk"
FROM THIS_PROCESS
ORDER BY 2
LIMIT 500
SELECT count(case_id) FROM THIS_PROCESS WHERE "Issue type" = '[System] Change' AND "Current Status category" != 'Done'

children.name: Number of Changes waiting for Authorization
children.description: Number of all Changes in Status 'Planning'

dataSource.query:
SELECT count(case_id) FROM THIS_PROCESS 
WHERE "Current status" = 'Planning'
 AND "Issue Type" = '[System] Change'

children.name: Number Open Emergency Changes
children.description: All Changes in 'Emergency' State and not in Status 'Done'

dataSource.query: SELECT count(case_id) FROM THIS_PROCESS WHERE "Change type" = 'Emergency' AND "Current Status category" != 'Done'

children.name: Number of Open Critical Risk Changes
children.description: All Changes in 'Critical' State and not in Status 'Done'

dataSource.query: SELECT count(case_id) FROM THIS_PROCESS WHERE "Change risk" = 'Critical' AND "Current Status category" != 'Done'

SELECT SUM ((SELECT LAST (END_TIME) - FIRST (END_TIME))) AS "Cycle Time", "Current Status"
FROM THIS_PROCESS WHERE "Issue type" = '[System] Change'
ORDER BY 1 DESC NULLS LAST
LIMIT 500

blocks.text: This tab focus on issue changes and analyze them by occurrence, type and risk.

children.name: Change Details Table
children.description: This table provides an Overview of all Changes and their details for further tracking

dataSource.query:
SELECT 
  "Issue key", 
  "Summary", 
  "Project", 
  "Current status", 
  "Issue type",
  "Issue Created Date", "Issue Resolution Date"
FROM THIS_PROCESS WHERE "Issue Type" = '[System] Change'
LIMIT 500
